FacilityName: LaPorte Co. Farm Bureau Coop, Union Mills NH3

_prev_prog_2.PC_OtherType: Administrative controls (Operation procedures) in place.  Equipment controls in place; remote manual shut-off valves & in-line excess flow automatic shut-down valves & load-out riser breakaway systems
_prev_prog_2.EquipmentTested: Piping, pumps, hoses, storage tanks and equipment

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
For further information contact:  Jim Keller, Plant Manager

Risk Management Plan - EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

1. The Facility Policy

    The owners, Management, and employees of LaPorte Co. Co-op, Union Mills Branch are committed 
    to the prevention of any accidental release of anhydrous ammonia.  If an accidental release should
    occur, the facility is prepared to work with the local fire department, or other authorities, to mitigate any
    release and minimize the impact of the release to people and the environment.

2. Facility Information.

   - This facility receives & stores grain from farmers and stores and blends fertilizer for sale to farmers.
   - Anhydrous ammonia is received, stored, and distributed for direct application for crop production  
     nutrients. 
   - The maximum quantity stored would be 1,100,000 pounds in the storage tank, rail cars and nurse tanks.
     The maximum quantity handled would be the unloading of a rail car holding 160,000 pounds.


3.  Accidental release prevention program.

     The Facility is in compiance with the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA),
     29CFR190.11, "storage and handling of anhydrous ammonia" and the State of Indiana code 355IAC.
     The OSHA standard is refrenced in this RMP registration form, see section 8.3(b).        

4. The Five-year Accident History 

   a. There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that:

   - Have caused any deaths, injuries, or significant property damage at the facility: nor to our knowledge,  
     have resulted in offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or  
     environmental damage.

5. The emergency action  program.

   a. The facility is included in the community emergency response plan developed under 42 U.S.C. 11003.
       This is the hazardous material plan developed and maintained by our Local Emergency Planning
       Committee (LEPC).

   b. LaPorte County Farm Bur

eau Co-op has elected not to respond and has coordinated the emergency
       response with LaPorte County Indiana Local Emergency Planning Committee and  the Noble
       Township Fire Department.

   c. If a large release of anhydrous ammonia takes place at the facility, the required response action is to
       evacuate the area of the spill and call 911 and all applicable emergency response numbers.

       1. Within 15 minutes of determing that the amount of the release would be over 100 pounds, the
           Emergency Coordinator will notify:

               The National Emergency Response Center @ 800-424-8802

       2. Immediately (within 1/2hour) after determining that the amount or release would be over 100 
           pounds, the Emergency Coordinator will notify:

               Indiana Dept. of Environmental Management @ 317-233-7745 or 888-233-7745

6. Planned changes to improve safety.

    Safety improvement is an on-going process at the facility.  Periodic evaluations are performed to  
    assess the maintenance of safe conditions.  There are no additional specific anhydrous ammonia  
    safety recommendations for implementation at this time.
